It’s one of two sessions organized by MLA’s Committee on Info Tech #mlaCIT. The idea is to prompt scholars to get ahead of the curve: “Instead of just critiquing major IT platforms that higher-ed institutions commit to, panelists ‘lead with the solution.’” (My intro will be about “Thinking at the ‘Enterprise Technology Systems’ Level.”)

You can have C symmetry with C² = 1, C symmetry with C² = -1, or no C symmetry.

You can have C symmetry with T² = 1, T symmetry with T² = -1, or no T symmetry.

That makes 3×3 = 9 options. The tenth option is S symmetry without C or T symmetry. In this case we can assume S² = 1.

But this is just the beginning of a very beautiful story! Here's my online intro to the tenfold way:

https://math.ucr.edu/home/baez/tenfold.html

Maybe I'll say more here later... when I figure some stuff out.

title: Free energy and specific heat near a quantum critical point of a metal

last_post.content: Today's #arXivsummary: https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.01873 by Zhang et. al. Authors study the free energy and specific heat for fermions interacting with gapless bosons at a quantum-critical point (QCP) in a metal. Three cases considered: Ising-nematic QCP, AFM QCP, & QCP for electrons interacting with Einstein phonons. Specific heat in the full fermion-boson model is independent of the cutoff and is positive all the way up to QCP. #CondMat #StrEl #arXiv_2301_01873

Magrit v0.13.0 has been released and is now online on https://magrit.cnrs.fr/ 🗺️
This version notably makes available a new type of contiguous cartograms, those based on the algorithm developed by Gastner, Seguy and More (2018).
The computation is performed solely in the browser thanks to a WebAssembly module (https://www.npmjs.com/package/go-cart-wasm). This is the first use of WebAssembly in Magrit, hoping that it will be satisfactory for the users!

title: Opinion | Want to Understand L.G.B.T.Q. Life in America? Come to Alabama.

last_post.content:
Powerful piece of journalism by Lydia Polgreen for the New York Times. It's in the opinion section, but to me it represents everything opinion ought to be, but rarely is, weaving the story of a math teacher in Alabama who was forced to retire after Libs of TikTok targeted him for also performing as a drag queen into a reflection on where we are, how we got here, and how, as queer people, we need to resist the movement to strip our humanity away.

https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/06/opinion/lgbtq-rights-activism-alabama.html

#Ultramark update!

Over the holidays, I started on a new markdown engine. It's a companion to https://github.com/natemoo-re/ultrahtml.

We need a fast, tiny, browser-friendly, and embeddable solution for Markdown.

Currently have about 25% of the Commonmark test suite passing. Code weighs in at about 800B gzip. Hoping to keep the final thing under 2kB.

For context:
• `marked` is 11kB
• `commonmark.js` is 25kB
• `markdown-it` is 33kB
• `remark` is 37kB
